page.title: 01A BLEAK AND BARREN HILLSIDE
page.content: It's a bleak, barren hillside with not a thing to be seen but bracken,rough grass and the occasional sheep --- and even they are huddled in their sheepskin coats! The only people to venture there are the farmer taking winter feed to his flock or digging them out of snowdrifts, and the gamekeeper with some huntsmen (usually Danes or Germans) after the red deer. Overhead circle the buzzards. Once I saw a golden eagle --- I think; but I may have been mistaken. In this place, the amenities we are asked to count seem so alien....The amenities here are wild solitude and strangely savage beauty. Do such qualities of life not count?
